thread.title: Brokers Managing $3.3 Billion Take Flight from Merrill Lynch
thread.title_full: Brokers Managing $3.3 Billion Take Flight from Merrill Lynch - WSJ

author: Michael Wursthorn
title: Brokers Managing $3.3 Billion Take Flight from Merrill Lynch
text:
Seven Merrill Lynch advisers who managed $3.3 billion for investors have left to form their own independent advisory practice, the latest defection from the brokerage’s elite client group.
The advisers worked in Merrill’s ultrawealthy client unit known as the Private Banking and Investment Group, which caters to individuals with $10 million or more in assets.
The clients of the Newport Beach, Calif., team included... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
